start.text: Let him who desires peace prepare for war.
Men grow tired of sleep, love, singing and dancing sooner than war.
Great empires are not maintained by timidity.
We do not ask how many enemies but where they are.
A disorderly mob is no more an army than a heap of building materials is a house.

retreat.text: To those that flee comes neither power nor glory.
A coward's mother does not weep.
War spares not the brave but the cowardly.

out_of_missiles.text: The fortunes of war are always doubtful.

engaged.text: Ah yes, mere infantry - poor beggars...
In the moment of action remember the value of silence and order.

need_help.text: It is a bad plan that cannot be altered.

pursuing.text: The valiant profit more their country than the finest, cleverest speakers.
What system knows not our blood?
In war we must be speedy.

running.text: Even the bravest men are frightened by sudden terrors.
When there is mutual fear, men think twice before they make aggression upon one another.
I am more afraid of our own mistakes than of our enemies' designs.
The man who runs away will fight again.

hull_90.text: The god of war hates those who hesitate.

hull_50.text: Even the bravest cannot fight beyond his strength.

hull_30.text: A brave man may fall, but he cannot yield.
It is the brave man's part to live with glory, or with glory die.

overload.text: What can a soldier do who charges when out of breath?
To blunder twice is not allowed in war.

death.text: A glorious death is his who for his country falls.
Only the dead have seen the end of the war.
Only the brave enjoy noble and glorious deaths.

victory.text: Let all be present and expect the palm, the prize of victory.
So ends the bloody business of the day.
The strong did what they could, and the weak suffered what they must.
We make war that we may live in peace.
A dead enemy always smells good.
Let them hate us as long as they fear us.
